story.text: In [[mathematics]], [[computer science]] and [[operations research]], __mathematical optimization__ (alternatively spelled ''optimisation'') or __mathematical programming__ is the selection of a best element (with regard to some criterion) from some set of available alternatives - [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mathematical_optimization wikipedia]
maximum]] at (''x, y, z'') = (0, 0, 4) is indicated by a blue dot - [https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Max_paraboloid.svg wikimedia]
Simionescu's function]]. Simplex vertices are ordered by their value, with 1 having the lowest (best) value - [https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Nelder-Mead_Simionescu.gif wikimedia]

In the simplest case, an [[optimization problem]] consists of [[maxima and minima]] a [[Function of a real variable]] by systematically choosing [[Argument of a function]] values from within an allowed set and computing the [[Value (mathematics)]] of the function. The generalization of optimization theory and techniques to other formulations constitutes a large area of [[applied mathematics]]. More generally, optimization includes finding "best available" values of some objective function given a defined [[domain of a function]] (or input), including a variety of different types of objective functions and different types of domains.
